bioghist.p: Jared Ingersoll (1749-1822) was an early American lawyer and statesman from Philadelphia. He was a delegate to the Continental Congress and signed the U.S. Constitution for Pennsylvania. He joined DeWitt Clinton on the Federalist Party ticket for the U.S. presidential election in 1812, but they were defeated. Ingersoll also served as Pennsylvania state attorney general, 1791-1800 and 1811-1816 and as the United States Attorney for Pennsylvania, 1800-1801.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of examples of legal documents relating largely to civil matters. It includes documents relating to debt, slander and libel, divorce, trespass, and various pleas, petitions, and judgments. The volume possibly belonged to Jared Ingersoll.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
